name: Hawaii Housing Authority v. Midkiff
question: Did the Land Reform Act of 1967 violate the Public Use Clause of the Fifth Amendment?

name: Roberts v. United States Jaycees
question: Did Minnesota's attempts to enforce the anti-discrimination law violate the Jaycees' right to free association under the First Amendment?

name: Immigration and Naturalization Service v. Phinpathya
question: Should the “continuous physical presence” requirement for suspension of deportation in the Immigration and Nationality Act be interpreted literally?
description: A case in which the Court held that the “continuous physical presence” requirement for suspension of deportation in the Immigration and Nationality Act should be interpreted literally.

name: Ellis v. Brotherhood of Railway, Airline & Steamship Clerks, Freight Handlers, Express & Station Employes
Helicopteros Nacionales de Colombia, S. A. v. Hall
Brown v. Department of Law and Public Safety
Members of the City Council of the City of Los Angeles v. Taxpayers for Vincent
Florida v. Meyers
question: Was the Court's summary disposition of the case constitutionally legitimate?

name: Koehler v. Engle
question: Did the jury instructions on malice and intent create an improper presumption of guilt in Engle's trial for first-degree murder? If so, was this a harmless error?

name: Board of Ed. of Paris Union School Dist. No. 95 v. Vail
United States v. Yermian
question: Does the government have to prove knowledge of federal agency jurisdiction in cases that deal with making false statements to a government department or agency?

name: National Collegiate Athletic Association v. Board of Regents of the University of Oklahoma
question: Does the NCAA plan for televised football games impose a restraint on the free market and thus violate the Sherman Act?

name: McDonough Power Equipment, Inc. v. Greenwood
National Labor Relations Board v. City Disposal Systems, Inc.
Migra v. Warren City School District Board of Education
Hishon v. King & Spalding
question: Did King & Spalding violate Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and unfairly discriminate against Hishon on the basis of her sex by denying her admission to the partnership?

name: Baldwin County Welcome Center v. Brown
Selective Service System v. Minnesota Public Interest Research Group
question: Did compelling individuals to state whether or not they had registered violate the Fifth Amendment?

name: Garcia v. San Antonio Metro. Transit Authority
question: Did principles of federalism make the San Antonio Metropolitan Transit Authority immune from the Fair Labor Standards Act?
description: A case in which the Court ruled that Congress has the power under the Commerce Clause of the Constitution to extend the Fair Labor Standards Act to state and local governments.

name: Three Affiliated Tribes of Fort Berthold Reservation v. Wold Engineering, P. C.
Chevron U. S. A. Inc. v. Natural Resources Defense Council, Inc.
question: Does the Clean Air Act permit the EPA to define the term "stationary source" to mean whole industrial plants only, which allows plants to build or modify units within plants without the permit required under the Act?

name: Schneider Moving & Storage Company v. Robbins
United States v. Weber Aircraft Corporation
Escondido Mutual Water Company v. La Jolla Band of Mission Indians
Interstate Commerce Commission v. American Trucking Associations, Inc.
Local No. 82, Furniture & Piano Moving, Furniture Store Drivers, Helpers, Warehousemen & Packers v. Crowley
Copperweld Corporation v. Independence Tube Corporation
Michigan v. Clifford
question: Does the Fourth Amendment allow for arson investigators to inspect the scene of a recent fire without a warrant in the absence of exigent circumstances and consent?
description: A case in which the Court held that a reasonable expectation of privacy remains within a burned building.

name: Securities and Exchange Commission v. Jerry T. O'Brien, Inc.
Building Trades & Construction Trades Council of Camden County and Vicinity v. Mayor and Council of the City of Camden
Capital Cities Cable, Inc. v. Crisp
question: Did Oklahoma's ban against retransmitting out-of-state cable signals containing alcoholic beverage commercials violate the Supremacy or Commerce Clauses?

name: Secretary of State of Maryland v. Joseph H. Munson Company, Inc.
Heckler v. Community Health Services of Crawford Cty., Inc.
Strickland v. Washington
question: What standard should be applied to determine whether a convicted person's Sixth Amendment right to counsel has been violated so as to require reversal of a conviction or to set aside a death sentence?

name: Pension Benefit Guaranty Corp. v. R. A. Gray & Co.
Immigration and Naturalization Service v. Delgado
INS v. Lopez-Mendoza
question: Do the strictures of the Fourth Amendment and the exclusionary rule apply in deportation proceedings?

name: Immigration and Naturalization Service v. Stevic
United States v. S.A. Empressa de Viacao Aerea Rio Grandense (Varig Airlines)
question: Can the U.S. be held liable under the FTCA for the FAA's decision to use the "spot-check" program to monitor compliance with airworthiness certification standards?

name: Dun & Bradstreet, Inc. v. Greenmoss Builders, Inc.
question: If a trial judge does not instruct the jury to only award punitive damages caused by intentional slander or reckless conduct, can a jury still award punitive damages to a plaintiff defamed by private speech?

name: South-Central Timber Development, Inc. v. Wunnicke
United States v. One Assortment of 89 Firearms
Monsanto Company v. Spray-Rite Service Corporation
Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms v. Federal Labor Relations Authority
Securities Industry Association v. Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System
Dickman v. Commissioner of Internal Revenue
National Labor Relations Board v. International Association of Bridge, Structural & Ornamental Ironworkers, Local 480, AFL-CIO
United States v. Arthur Young & Company
New York v. Quarles
question: Should the Court suppress Quarles's statement about the gun and the gun itself because the officer had failed at the time to read Quarles his Miranda rights?

name: Heckler v. Matthews
question: Did the resurrection of pre-California law which allowed some gender-based classification in Social Security allocations violate the Due Process Clause of the Fifth Amendment?

name: Sure-Tan, Inc. v. National Labor Relations Board
question: Does the National Labor Rights Act allow the National Labor Relations Board to properly find that an employer has engaged in unfair labor practices by reporting illegal union laborers to the Immigration and Naturalization Service in retaliation for economic activity and issue a remedial order?

name: Bacchus Imports Ltd. v. Dias
question: Did Hawaii law violate the Import-Export Clause and the Commerce Clause of the Constitution?

name: Bose Corporation v. Consumers Union of United States, Inc.
question: Was Consumer Union's article written with "actual malice," thereby placing it outside the First Amendment's freedom of speech protections?

name: Nix v. Williams
question: Should evidence resulting in an arrest be excluded from trial because it was improperly obtained?

name: Kirby Forest Industries, Inc. v. United States
New Jersey v. T.L.O.
question: Does the exclusionary rule apply to searches conducted by school officials in public schools?
description: A case in which the Court held that a New Jersey public school principal has the right to search a student's purse without a warrant so long as the search is reasonable under the circumstances.

name: Massachusetts v. Sheppard
question: If police officers mistakenly believe they have obtained a valid warrant, can a trial court use the evidence they obtained?

name: Berkemer v. McCarty
question:
1. Did the highway patrol err in failing to give a Miranda warning to McCarty before he made incriminating statements at the station house?

2. Did the Ohio State Highway Patrol err in failing to give a Miranda warning to McCarty when he was detained pursuant to a routine traffic stop and under suspicion for the misdemeanor of driving under the influence?

name: Justices of Boston Municipal Court v. Lydon
Aloha Airlines, Inc. v. Director of Taxation of Hawaii
United States v. Leon
question: Is there a "good faith" exception to the exclusionary rule?
description: A case in which the Court ruled that there is an exception to the exclusionary rule for evidence gathered in "good faith."

name: Commissioner of Internal Revenue v. Engle
question: Did 26 U.S.C. § 613A of the Internal Revenue Code authorize percentage depletion deductions on advance royalties and bonuses from oil and gas leases for independent producers?

name: Michigan Canners & Freezers Association, Inc. v. Agricultural Marketing and Bargaining Board
Jefferson Parish Hospital District No. 2 v. Hyde
United States v. Karo
question: Does the installation of a tracking device into a container, with the permission of the original owner, constitute a seizure within the meaning of the 4th Amendment when the container is delivered to a buyer having no knowledge of the tracking device?

name: Iron Arrow Honor Society v. Heckler
Clark v. Community for Creative Non-Violence
question: Did the National Park Service regulations violate the First Amendment by curtailing symbolic speech?

name: Irving Independent School District v. Tatro
question:
Was the provision of CIC for a student with a neurogenic bladder a required ‘related service’ under the Education of the Handicapped Act?

If so, could the Tatros seek attorneys’ fees through the Rehabilitation Act although other relief was available under the EHA?

name: Minnesota v. Murphy
question: Does the Fifth Amendment require suppression of a probationer's incriminating admissions where the probationer is required to meet with his probation officer and to be truthful, and the probation officer has reason to believe that the probationer's answers to her questions are likely to be incriminating?

name: Federal Communications Commission v. ITT World Communications, Inc.
Aluminum Company of America v. Central Lincoln Peoples' Utility District
Grove City College v. Bell
question: Was Grove City College subject to federal requirements because its students received federal grants? Did the provisions of Title IX violate the First Amendments rights of the College?

name: Federal Communications Commission v. League of Women Voters of California
question: Did the ban on editorializing violate the First Amendment?

name: Franchise Tax Board of California v. United States Postal Service
Palmore v. Sidoti
question: Did the removal of the child from Linda Sidoti's custody violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: California v. Trombetta
question: Does the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment require law enforcement agencies to preserve breath samples of suspected drunk drivers so that results of breath analysis tests may be used at trial?
description: A case in which the Court held that the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment does not require law enforcement agencies to preserve breath samples of suspected drunk drivers so that results of breath analysis tests may be used at trial.

name: Hudson v. Palmer
question: Did the search of Palmer's locker and cell violate the Fourth Amendment? Did prison officials deprive Palmer of his property in violation of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Waller v. Georgia
question: Did the closure of the hearing violate the right to a public trial under the Sixth and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: United States v. Jacobsen
question: Does the Fourth Amendment prohibit the warrantless testing of the suspicious powder?

name: McKaskle v. Wiggins
question: Does the presence of standby counsel violate a defendant’s Sixth Amendment right to represent himself?

name: Lynch v. Donnelly
question: Did the inclusion of a nativity scene in the city's display violate the Establishment Clause of the First Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that a nativity scene in the city's shopping district did not violate the Establishment Clause of the First Amendment.

name: Norfolk Redevelopment and Housing Authority v. Chesapeake and Potomac Telephone Company of Virginia
Trans World Airlines, Inc. v. Franklin Mint Corporation
Summa Corporation v. California ex rel. State Lands Commission
Schall v. Martin
question: Is the pretrial detention of a juvenile delinquent a violation of the right to Due Process as guaranteed in the Fourteenth Amendment if there is a “serious risk” that the juvenile will “commit an act which if committed by an adult would constitute a crime”?

name: Badaracco v. Commissioner of Internal Revenue
Firefighters Local Union No. 1784 v. Stotts
Capital Cities Media, Inc. v. Toole
Secretary of the Interior v. California
Calder v. Jones
question: Did Calder and South have sufficient contacts with the state of California to give California state courts personal jurisdiction over Jones’ claim of libel?

name: Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority v. Johnson
United States v. Cronic
question: Must there be proof of specific errors on the part of counsel in order to show a violation of the Sixth Amendment right to effective assistance of counsel?

name: Press-Enterprise Co. v. Superior Court of Cal., Riverside Cty.
Oliver v. United States
question: Does the open field doctrine apply when police officers knowingly enter privately owned fields without a warrant?

name: Minnesota Bd. For Community Colleges v. Knight
Daily Income Fund, Inc. v. Fox
Pulliam v. Allen
question: Does judicial immunity protect a member of the judiciary acting in her official capacity from paying attorneys’ fees in a civil suit?

name: Cooper v. Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond
McDonald v. City of West Branch, Michigan
Block v. Rutherford
question: Was the Los Angeles County Central Jail's practice of prohibiting detainees from having contact visits and from being present while their cells were searched reasonably related to a legitimate governmental objective?

name: Hayfield Northern Railroad Company, Inc. v. Chicago & North Western Transportation Company
Heckler v. Day
question: Does the judiciary's imposition of deadlines by which disability claims must be processed constitute an unconstitutional interference with a legislatively mandated statute?

name: Securities Industry Association v. Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System
Keeton v. Hustler Magazine, Inc.
question: Was Hustler's circulation of magazines within the forum state of New Hampshire alone sufficient, without regard to the depth of plaintiff's contacts or the amount of plaintiff's damages caused in New Hampshire, to support an assertion of personal jurisdiction in a libel action based upon the contents of the magazine?

name: United States v. Stauffer Chemical Company
question: Does a state court’s ruling in a prior case that involved the same party, issue of law, and nearly identical fact scenario prevent the government from re-litigating that issue in a different venue?
description: A case in which the Court held that the EPA's case against Stauffer was precluded by the doctrine of collateral estoppell.

name: National Labor Relations Board v. Bildisco & Bildisco
Allen v. Wright
question: Did the IRS shirk its enforcement duties and encourage private schools to racially discriminate, thus, harming desegregation efforts in the nation's public schools?
